sentence: It shouldn't be hard to persuade this Congress  because our Republican majorities in both Houses have been unable to  muster the courage to oppose other Trumpian blunders, whether they are  tariffs that burden families with higher grocery bills or the  deprivation of millions of Americans without healthcare coverage or the  kleptocratic meme coin schemes to enrich the Trump family by more than  $200 million.
In Michigan, in my State alone, over 450,000 people are now at risk  of losing their healthcare coverage, including children, seniors, and  people with disabilities in our district.
Even if  my colleagues don't think that is a problem, Madam Speaker, this  literally makes healthcare coverage worse for every single person  living in rural America.
This is not the  time to be taking away healthcare coverage or increasing premiums on  anyone.
The first thing that is going to happen is 17 million Americans,  including 9 million people on Medicaid, will lose healthcare coverage  in about 18 months' time.

In 2025, House Republicans failed to bring one bill to the floor to  lower the cost of living or to tackle the high rate of inflation, but  here is some good news actually: By tomorrow, thanks to House Democrats  and a handful of Republicans who stood up to their Speaker, the House  will vote to lower the cost of healthcare coverage for millions of  Americans.
Their new law will cruelly take healthcare coverage away from 15  million Americans.
It is why I voted against the big, ugly bill that  is now putting healthcare coverage at risk for millions of Americans  while raising energy costs for families.
And we are fighting for families across  America who are about to see their healthcare coverage go up or maybe  even be eliminated.

Instead of lowering prices, Republicans passed a bill to cut nearly a  trillion dollars from Medicaid and the Affordable Care Act, which will  strip healthcare coverage for more than 15 million people.
It will let people  die from the lack of healthcare coverage.
Almost 14 million  Americans will lose healthcare coverage if the Republicans go forward  with their plan.
They are willing to do that by selling out  healthcare coverage for 80 million Americans.
Across the country, more than 4 million Americans have  already lost or are at risk of losing their healthcare coverage  entirely.

This is just one more step along the way to try to find some way to  overcome the terrible burden that the Trump administration and the  Republicans have placed on Americans as they go about trying to provide  healthcare coverage for themselves, for their families, and for their  communities.

From groundbreaking biomedical advancements through the NIH to  critical healthcare coverage for America's most vulnerable patients,  the Department of Health and Human Services oversees many of the  Federal Government's most essential functions.

The original agreement and the conversation was that every State  would allow some options that would have elective abortions for your  healthcare coverage and some options that you could choose without  that--except now that there are 12, maybe 13 States working that don't  allow any option of the Affordable Care Act, of ObamaCare, to be in  their State that doesn't also require abortion coverage.

So you have got, in  the individual marketplace, which is the blue here, almost 50 percent  of Americans--that is about 150 million Americans--who get their  healthcare coverage through their employer.

This legislation will make it easier for small businesses to offer  quality, affordable healthcare coverage to their employees by allowing  them to band together to have access to the same regulatory and  economic benefits as large group plans.
This important legislation will expand treatment options for  Americans living with chronic diseases provided through their  employer's healthcare coverage.
This legislation provides employers and their employees with greater  flexibility to design healthcare coverage options that expand access to  treatments for chronic diseases.
One of the  accusations made is that it will take away healthcare coverage from  people who need it.

The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services reports 39 percent of  the people who signed up for healthcare coverage on ObamaCare this year  got health insurance, and they paid absolutely nothing for it--zero.

I am honored that this package includes my bill, the CHOICE  Arrangement Act, which makes it easier for small businesses--something  that I know something about after 35 years in business--to offer  healthcare coverage.
